result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance A Kyles Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrance A Kyles Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Terrance A Kyles Jr.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final Pre-Trial.  Discussion held OFF THE RECORD. Court advised essential witnesses are not available for scheduled Jury Trial.  Court finds good cause to adjourn the Jury Trial set for 10/24/2022.  Court sets new dates for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance A Kyles Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Terrance A Kyles Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Jon Josephsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Final Pretrial.  Attorney Josephsen will be handling this matter for trial set on 10/24/2022, but is currently in trial in another court and unavailable to appear today. Court finds good cause to set this matter for adjourned final pretrial. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, filed.
Addendum to State's Witness List, filed

Defendant Terrance A Kyles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Terrance A Kyles in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting trial dates. Court sets the following deadlines:
- 09/23/2022: deadline for the State to complete and turnover all crime lab reports to defense.
- 10/07/2022: deadline to file change of plea forms.
- 10/14/2022: deadline to file all final pretrial documents, including written stipulations of fact.
- 10/18/2022: final day Court will accept any negotiated resolutions.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse. Case is adjourned for jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Terrance A Kyles not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Court ordered discovery turned over on or before 6/1/22. Any motions or change of plea forms due on or before 6/21/22.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Terrance A Kyles in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Terrance A Kyles in custody.  BOTH APPEARED BY VIDEO.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Court took judicial notice of 14CF165.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Vashaun Young.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terrance A Kyles in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Terrance A Kyles in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrance A Kyles appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
